Q2

Class Detective

  • java.lang.Object
    • Q2.Detective

  • public class Detective
extends java.lang.Object
    A mystery solver by decode a letter from string. String is valid if all the character appears the same number of time. for validation, it can remove just 1 character at one index in the string, and the remaining characters will occur the same number of times.
    Version:
    22.2.25
    Author:
    SaGaR VaRiyA

    • Field Detail

      • arrLen

        private int arrLen
        use arrLen to store the distinct character length. use charCnt1 and charCnt2 to store 2 different character count in string. use letters to store the original string of letters. use charArr to store all unique letter. use charCountArr to store all unique letter appear count.

      • charCnt1

        private int charCnt1

      • charCnt2

        private int charCnt2

        private final java.lang.String letters

      • charCountArr

        private final int[] charCountArr

      • Detective

        public Detective(java.lang.String str)
        Construct a Detective with the original string of letters. Create array according to letters length.

        str - original string of letters.

    • Method Detail

      • checkCharExist

        private boolean checkCharExist(char c,
                               int len)
        Check if the character is existed in counted array. If character exist then increase the count of that character.
        Parameters:
        c - Character to check existence.
        len - To check in between the length.
        Returns:
        True if character exist else False.

      • calcChars

        private void calcChars()
        see checkCharExist(char, int) Calculate the unique characters and their number of appearance. using checkCharExist it will take decision.
        See Also:
        checkCharExist(char, int)

      • giveOccurrence

        private int giveOccurrence(int n)
        Give how many times the number of character count appear in charCountArr.
        Parameters:
        n - Get its occurrence.
        Returns:
        Occurrence of the given number.

      • isValid

        private boolean isValid()
        see calcChars() see giveOccurrence(int) A function to check if the given letter of string is valid or not.
        Returns:
        True if letters are valid else False.
        See Also:
        calcChars(), giveOccurrence(int)

      • removeChar

        private char removeChar(int counts)
        Remove the character that appear give number of time in letters.
        Parameters:
        counts - Appear count to remove.
        Returns:
        The character that will be removed.

      • getRemovalChar

        private char getRemovalChar()
        see removeChar(int) see giveOccurrence(int) Decide which character to remove based on its appearance.
        Returns:
        The character that will be removed.
        See Also:
        removeChar(int), giveOccurrence(int)

      • decode

        public char decode()
        see isValid() see getRemovalChar() Decode the letters and give removal character.
